H0.text: what are the two extracellular fluid compartments in the body. Plasma and Lymph

H1.text: what are the two extracellular fluid compartments in the body. Blood and Tissue Fluid

H2.text: what are the two extracellular fluid compartments in the body. Circulatory and Transcellular Fluid

H3.text: what are the two extracellular fluid compartments in the body. interstitial

A4.text: Plasma and interstitial fluid are the two components that make up at least 97% of the ECF.

A5.text: The main component of the extracellular fluid (ECF) is the interstitial fluid, which surrounds the cells in the body.

A6.text: Lymph makes up a small percentage of the interstitial fluid.

A7.text: The other major component of the ECF is the intravascular fluid of the circulatory system called blood plasma.
